articles.title: Kim Jong Il meets special envoy of south side and his party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il meets special envoy of south side and his party 
    Pyongyang,Aapril 5 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il yesterday met with Rim Tong Won, special adviser to President Kim Dae Jung on diplomacy, security and unification on a visit to Pyongyang and his party Kim Po Hyon, vice-chief of the intelligence service, Jo Myong Gyun, department director of the Ministry of Unification, and So Hun, director of Chongwadae.
 Present there were Kim Yong Sun, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Rim Tong Ok, first vice department director.    
 The special envoy courteously conveyed a personal letter from Kim Dae Jung to Kim Jong Il. 
 Kim Jong Il expressed thanks for it and had a cordial conversation with him.
 Kim Jong Il hosted a dinner for the special envoy and his party.

S. Korean singer Kim Ryon Ja arrives
articles.content:
S. Korean singer Kim Ryon Ja arrives
     Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Ryon Ja, a South Korean singer in Japan, and her party arrived here yesterday to participate in the 20th April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
 They were met at the airport by Jang Chol, chairman of the organizing committee of the festival, Song Sok Hwan, vice-minister of culture, and Jo Yong Hwa, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang city people's committee, who are vice-chairmen of the organizing committee, and other officials concerned.
